title.narrative: NIHR Global Health Research Unit on Global Surgery: Establishing a Sustainable Network of Surgical Research

description.narrative:
Research Objectives: 1. Generate randomised evidence to support sustainable expansion of surgical workforces. 2. Accelerate and sustain a pipeline of research to improve outcomes after surgery in LMICs. 3. Develop evidence to create resilient surgical systems. 4. Generate evidence to support resource allocation decisions through trial and model based economic evaluation alongside the primary research.
Education and Training Objectives: 1. Facilitate staged transfer of research leadership to LMIC Hub Directors. 2. Establish sustainable training in surgical research methods. 3. Develop data management and analysis capability. 4. Develop new cohort of surgical research leaders. 5. Facilitate development of clinical research management teams. 6. Create and utilise sustainable South to South learning pathways.
Community Engagement and Inclusion (CEI) Objectives: 1. Establish a flexible and sustainable LMIC led CEI steering group in each partner country. 2. Develop an LMIC led CEI strategy for research project, with an integrated South to South feedback loop. 3. Bespoke training through South to South learning. 4. Make CEI steering group advocates for surgical research through engagement with key stakeholders (communities, relevant policy makers).
Impact Objectives: 1. To connect research outputs to multiple stakeholders (patients, clinicians, policy makers). 2. To establish and maintain two-way pathways for stakeholder engagement. 3. To establish local and global pathways to policymakers. 4. To create a sustainable framework for Impact assessment around the 6 domains of healthcare quality.

The NIHR Global Health Research Unit on Global Surgery (GSU) initially funded in 2017, established seven surgical research Hubs (Benin, Rwanda, Ghana, India, Nigeria, Mexico, South Africa), coordinating research through more than 70 ‘spoke’ hospitals across three continents, prioritised through LMIC led Delphi processes (2016-20).
In this funding envelope we will seek excellence through a new body of prioritised primary research, equitable partnerships through transfer of research leadership to the Hubs, sustainability through new Hub-based training centres.
